parameters:
...We are powerless. We have no choice but to rely on you.
Please, defeat the bandits in their stronghold. We beg of
you.

I am truly delighted that you have liberated this village
from the bandits! Karin-dono and Yugiri-dono are the saviors
of this village!

Have you come to cause trouble in our village again?! I
don't care if I'm killed today! I'll fight to the end alone!

Wait! Village chief! We should have sent a letter ahead! We
are not bandits! We have come to help this village!

Hmm? Could it be that you are officials from the shogunate?
My apologies. I thought bandits had come to extort us again.

(Given the poor public order of the village, it's no wonder
the village chief has such a rough temperament...)

I am Yugiri, the leader of the Iga ninja group--and this is
the kunoichi Karin. We would like to know as much as
possible about the bandits.

Yes. Those bandits suddenly came to this village a few
months ago... They built a fortress in the nearby mountains
and have been causing us a great deal of trouble. The
villagers alone are no match for their numbers; we are truly
at our wits' end...
Is it true that they are abducting the village girls?

Indeed. They call it "hunting women" and have been attacking
villages in this area. Young village girls have been taken,
and we cannot retrieve them. Even when we report to the lord
of the land, given this village's already notorious
reputation, they are reluctant to send soldiers to deal with
the bandits...

(It's like a village that's been abandoned. To think that
the lord would ignore them...)

I apologize for what has happened until now, village
chief... But now that we are here, we will show no mercy to
the bandits. In the name of the shogunate's authority, we
will take down their fortress.

Oh! Is that true? I am glad to hear that, but there is one
concern... Please be careful of the bandits' leader.
The bandits' leader...? What kind of man is he?

Yes. He's a large man who wears old-fashioned armor from the
Warring States period. He wields a long and thick katana
that exceeds the height of a man; his name is Magara, if I
recall correctly.

Yes. He usually stays deep within the bandit fortress and
rarely shows himself. I've only seen him from a distance
once, but he had an aura that didn't seem human--like the
visage of a demon.

Ever since the bandits arrived, the villagers' morale has
only worsened... As the village chief, I am honestly
exhausted. Please save our Suranamu Village. I beg of you!

I see... Understood. We will rescue the abducted village
girls and ensure that the bandits, and their leader Magara,
are defeated.

We will definitely resolve this since we have come. Please
rest assured, village chief.

Oh! Thank you so much--! Please wipe out those bandits! This
is a small token of our gratitude. Please use it as military
funds.

--Received \c[17]3000 mon\c[0] from the village chief of
Suranamu Village!

Village chief, you mentioned that the bandit leader seemed
like a demon...

Yes. According to reports from my subordinates, that bandit
leader Magara--most likely, he is indeed a real demon.

He might be one of the war demons we saw at the haunted
mansion in Yotsuya... If we have to fight him, he'll be a
formidable enemy.

Alright. Now that we've greeted the village chief of
Suranamu Village, let's head out to subdue the bandits. It's
better to move sooner rather than later.

Understood. By the way, don't you think we might be more
suspicious if we're seen together?

That's true. Our faces are known to the demons from our
previous battle. Let's split up for now. I'll gather
information on the bandit fortress while staying hidden from
sight.

Sure. Let's act separately for a while and gather
information, then meet back here later.

Alright then, Karin--not just the bandits, but also many of
Suranamu Village's residents are violent types. Be careful
as you gather information. Let's meet back here later,

--Karin parted ways with Yugiri and began exploring Suranamu
Village.
